question.text: Identify the wrong statement in the context of heartwood.

options.text: Organic compounds are deposited in it
It conducts water and minerals efficiently
It comprises dead elements with highly lignified walls

solution.text: Heartwood is physiologically inactive due to the deposition of organic compounds and tyloses formation, so this will not conduct water and minerals. Heartwood is the central cylinder found in tree trunks. Heartwood forms as the tree ages, and the inner xylem cells lose the capacity to transmit water. Heartwood tends to be darker in colour than sapwood since it is normally filled with various types of oils, dyes, and sugars. The primary function of heartwood is to provide adequate support to the tree.
